oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Manufacturers' Record obituary for Joseph Buckner Killebrew
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Agriculture
Agriculture; Killebrew, J. B. (Joseph Buckner), 1831-1906; Obituaries; Mines and mineral resources
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This front-page obituary that appeared in the March 22, 1906, issue of the Manufacturers' Record for Joseph Buckner Killebrew highlighted his life-long devotion to agriculture. His contributions to the South with regard to agriculture, mining, industry and commerce, education, immigration, and the development of the railroads are emphasized, as well as his writings and editorships.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Manufacturers' Record, Baltimore, Md.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Manufacturers' Record was the leading business journal in the South during this time period. Editor Richard H. Edmonds sought to promote capital investment in the South and industrialization and used this paper as a tool. Killebrew was a regular contributor to this publication and, for the last eight years of his life, served on the editorial staff of the Southern Farm Magazine, also published by the Manufacturers' Record Publishing Co.
